candidates.title: remove tokio runners
candidates.body:
## PR Type
Refactor


## PR Checklist
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added / updated.
- [x] Documentation comments have been added / updated.
- [x] A changelog entry has been made for the appropriate packages.
- [x] Format code with the latest stable rustfmt


## Overview
- Remove `run_in_tokio` and `attach_to_tokio`.
- Remove `AsyncSystemRunner`.
- Return `JoinHandle` from `actix_rt::spawn`.
	- Remove old `Arbiter::spawn`. Implementation is now inlined into `actix_rt::spawn`.
- Rename `Arbiter::{send => spawn}` and `Arbiter::{exec_fn => spawn_fn}`.
- Remove `Arbiter::exec`.
- Remove deprecated `Arbiter::local_join`.

candidates.title: change default name resolver and allow custom resolvers
candidates.body:
## PR Type
<!-- What kind of change does this PR make? -->
<!-- Bug Fix / Feature / Refactor / Code Style / Other -->
Refactor


## PR Checklist
Check your PR fulfills the following:

<!-- For draft PRs check the boxes as you complete them. -->

- [x] Tests for the changes have been added / updated.
- [x] Documentation comments have been added / updated.
- [x] A changelog entry has been made for the appropriate packages.
- [x] Format code with the latest stable rustfmt


## Overview
<!-- Describe the current and new behavior. -->
<!-- Emphasize any breaking changes. -->
Remove `trust-dns` dependencies. 
Use `tokio::net::lookup_host` for simple dns lookup to improve compile time and reduce deps.

Make `Resolver` an enum type that accept custom `Resolve` trait object for custom resolver implementation.

Remove `either` and `futures-util` dep and simplify the connector and service logic.

Rework `connect` mod and remove duplicated iterator types. Reduce nested `Either` type and simplify Addrs to an enum.

export `webpki_roots::TLS_SERVER_ROOTS` in `connect` mod and remove it from `accept` mod. This is a type used only on client

Add more `connect` mod doc.

Remove commented code from `actix-rt`

<!-- If this PR fixes or closes an issue, reference it here. -->
<!-- Closes #000 -->

candidates.title: add actix-rt::task
candidates.body:
## PR Type
<!-- What kind of change does this PR make? -->
<!-- Bug Fix / Feature / Refactor / Code Style / Other -->
Feature


## PR Checklist
Check your PR fulfills the following:

<!-- For draft PRs check the boxes as you complete them. -->

- [x] Documentation comments have been added / updated.
- [x] A changelog entry has been made for the appropriate packages.
- [x] Format code with the latest stable rustfmt


## Overview
<!-- Describe the current and new behavior. -->
<!-- Emphasize any breaking changes. -->
Enable `parking_lot` feature for tokio.

Add `actix_rt::task` mod that would re-export:
- `spawn_blocking` which can be used to replace `actix-threadpool`.
- `JoinHandle` which can be used to manage spawned tasks.
- `yield_now` which can be used to actively yield back to scheduler. 

<!-- If this PR fixes or closes an issue, reference it here. -->
<!-- Closes #000 -->

candidates.title: prepare bytestring release 1.0.0
candidates.body:
## PR Type
Improvement / Release


## PR Checklist
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added / updated.
- [x] Documentation comments have been added / updated.
- [x] A changelog entry has been made for the appropriate packages.
- [x] Format code with the latest stable rustfmt


## Overview
* Add array and slice of `u8` impls of TryFrom up to 32 in length.
* Rename `get_ref` to `as_bytes` and rename `into_inner` to `into_bytes`.
* `ByteString::new` is now a `const fn`.
* Crate is now `#[no_std]` compatible.

candidates.body:
## PR Type
Refactor


## PR Checklist

- [x] A changelog entry has been made for the appropriate packages.

## Overview
- remove service benchmarks
- add helper macros for poll_ready implementations
- use `pin-project-lite`
- enable `#[no_std]`
- removes `and_then_apply_fn` because it's just sugar for `.and_then(apply_fn(...))` and was causing issues with `pin-project-lite`

candidates.title: service trait takes request type parameter
candidates.body:
## PR Type
Improvement


## PR Checklist
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added / updated.
- [x] Documentation comments have been added / updated.
- [x] A changelog entry has been made for the appropriate packages.
- [x] Format code with the latest stable rustfmt


## Overview
It's advantageous to accept multiple request types for a given service. I believe this will simplify some of the complex types and handling in actix-web http1/http2 request dispatching.

Obviously massive breaking change to actix-service. Other breaking changes include:

actix-connect:
- new_connector()
- new_connector_factory()
- default_connector()
- default_connector_factory()

actix-server:
- ServiceFactory
- ServiceRuntime::service()

By default `actix-rt` always re-export `actix-threadpool` and it's not alway used by the crates importing it.
This PR removes the dependecy.

As a result actix would have 3 less deps.

candidates.title: remove RUNNING Q PENDING thread locals from actix-rt
candidates.body:
## PR Type
<!-- What kind of change does this PR make? -->
<!-- Bug Fix / Feature / Refactor / Code Style / Other -->
Bug Fix


## PR Checklist
Check your PR fulfills the following:

<!-- For draft PRs check the boxes as you complete them. -->

- [x] Documentation comments have been added / updated.
- [x] A changelog entry has been made for the appropriate packages.
- [x] Format code with the latest stable rustfmt


## Overview
These thread locals are either outdated or are slowing down actix-rt when it's under heavy work load with long live streams. I have a feeling there are more issues related to it besides the issues mentioned.

This PR would break both actix-web and actix.


Closes #205 
Closes #206

candidates.title: tokio 1.0 and mio 0.7
candidates.body:
## PR Type
<!-- What kind of change does this PR make? -->
<!-- Bug Fix / Feature / Refactor / Code Style / Other -->
Refactor and Dependency


## PR Checklist
Check your PR fulfills the following:

<!-- For draft PRs check the boxes as you complete them. -->

- [x] Tests for the changes have been added / updated.
- [x] Documentation comments have been added / updated.
- [x] A changelog entry has been made for the appropriate packages.
- [x] Format code with the latest stable rustfmt


## Overview
Tracking PRs:
- [x]  [actix-rt](https://github.com/actix/actix-net/pull/236)
- [x] [actix-codec](https://github.com/actix/actix-net/pull/237)
- [x] [actix-utils](https://github.com/actix/actix-net/pull/237)
- [x] [actix-server](https://github.com/actix/actix-net/pull/239)
- [x] [actix-testing](https://github.com/actix/actix-net/pull/239)
- [x] [actix-connect/actix-tls (merged into one crate)](https://github.com/actix/actix-net/pull/238)

There should be not much of breaking changes from this PR but it does introduce a new dep and some rewrite of core logic to cooperate the break changes of upstream deps like mio.

Although the tests are passing but I highly doubt it would work flawlessly so some deep review would be necessaray.

Closes #197, closes #201, closes #203

candidates.title: move and update server+tls examples
candidates.body:
## PR Type
Docs


## PR Checklist
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added / updated.
- [x] Documentation comments have been added / updated.
- [x] Format code with the latest stable rustfmt


## Overview
A start on making these lower level primitives more accessible. Up until now the examples folder has not been part of any package and therefore hasn't been compile checked in CI.

This PR updates and documents the examples as well as generates a new key/cert pair for the TLS example. (Plus a couple docs tweaks that aren't important enough for changelog entries.)

candidates.title: prepare server release 1.0.4
candidates.body:
## PR Type
Release


## PR Checklist
- [x] Tests for the changes have been run against actix-web.
- [x] A changelog entry has been made for the appropriate packages.
- [x] Format code with the latest stable rustfmt


## Overview
actix-server v1.0.3 uses actix-codec 0.2.0 so this patch release can remove that (unsafe) dependency.

While technically "breaking", I feel that the change ensuring that worker counts are greater than 0 is an acceptable one since a server is no good without at least 1 worker. As a quick check, I did a search of GitHub for `.workers(0)` in Rust files and came back with nothing. Thoughts from @actix/contributors are valuable here.

candidates.title: actix-rt: Make the process of running System in existing Runtime more clear
candidates.body:
## PR Type
<!-- What kind of change does this PR make? -->
<!-- Bug Fix / Feature / Refactor / Code Style / Other -->
Other (Usability enhancement)


## PR Checklist
Check your PR fulfills the following:

<!-- For draft PRs check the boxes as you complete them. -->

- [x] Tests for the changes have been added / updated.
- [x] Documentation comments have been added / updated.
- [x] A changelog entry has been made for the appropriate packages.
- [x] Format code with the latest stable rustfmt


## Overview

When I first tried to start the `actix-web` server using an existing `tokio` `Runtime`, I honestly found the interface a bit unfriendly.

In an attempt to make other folks' life easier I did the following:

- Added doc-comments with an example and a note about `Arbiter`s still using their own `Runtime` objects.
- Added a new method which is less flexible but simpler to use to attach a `System` to a given `Runtime`.

These changes aren't breaking and hopefully useful.

candidates.title: threadpool: Bump up to 0.3.3
candidates.body: This drops the use of `parking_lot` v0.10 on the actix crate.

candidates.title: Use `OR` instead of deprecated `/` in license field
Remove uses of pin_project::project attribute
candidates.body:
pin-project will deprecate the project attribute due to some unfixable
limitations.

Refs: https://github.com/taiki-e/pin-project/issues/225

*Although the deprecation of the project attribute has not been released yet, this PR is submitted in advance to avoid the CI from being broken by deprecated warnings.*

chosen_detail.title: prepare rt and tls releases
chosen_detail.body:
## PR Type
Release


## PR Checklist
- [x] A changelog entry has been made for the appropriate packages.
- [x] Format code with the latest stable rustfmt

repo.name: actix-net
